Hi,

 I am trying to use the assertFile to get the diff between an actual 
file and an expect file. Though the 2 files are identical. The test 
is as simple as below. 

public void testAssertion() throws Exception
  {
    File userHome = new File("d:/", "APITest.diff");
    File testFile = new File("d:/", "APITest.actual");
    File passFile = new File("d:/", "APITest.expect");
        
    // compare two files and store possible differencies in the 
output file
    assertFile(testFile.getAbsolutePath(), passFile.getAbsolutePath
(), userHome.getAbsolutePath(), new junit.diff.SimpleDiff());

  }

The above test fails with the following error message:

     [java]
     [java] FAILURES!!!
     [java] Test Results:
     [java] Run: 1 Failures: 1 Errors: 0
     [java] There was 1 failure:

     [java]     at junit.framework.Assert.assertFile(Assert.java:192)
     [java]     at junit.framework.Assert.assertFile(Assert.java:214)

Case.java:168)
     [java]     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
     [java]     at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:156)

(TestResult.java:100)

(TestResult.java:118)

(TestSuite.java:149)

Compiled Code)
     [java]     at junit.textui.TestRunner.doRun(TestRunner.java:63)
     [java]     at junit.textui.TestRunner.start(TestRunner.java, 
Compiled Code)

     [java]     at junit.textui.TestRunner.main(TestRunner.java:89)
     [java]     at com.i2.gs.jtest.TestSuite.main(TestSuite.java:113)

Does anyone know why?

Thanks!!!
